unnormalised: EdTech Startup 'Padhai-Wadhai' Faces Hilarious Glitch: Students Score 110% on Exams!
normalised: EdTech Startup 'Padhai-Wadhai' Faces Hilarious Glitch: Students Score one hundred and ten percent on Exams!

unnormalised: In a bizarre turn of events, online learning platform Padhai-Wadhai, known for its "guaranteed success" tagline, is grappling with a rather unusual problem: students are scoring above 100% on their exams. The glitch, affectionately dubbed "The Sharma Ji Effect" after a particularly high-scoring student, has left the company scrambling to understand the root cause.
normalised: In a bizarre turn of events, online learning platform Padhai-Wadhai, known for its "guaranteed success" tagline, is grappling with a rather unusual problem: students are scoring above one hundred percent on their exams. The glitch, affectionately dubbed "The Sharma Ji Effect" after a particularly high-scoring student, has left the company scrambling to understand the root cause.

unnormalised: "Initially, we thought it was a fluke," chuckled CEO Mr. Rajesh Kumar, wiping his brow during a press conference held at 3 PM yesterday. "But then, *everyone* started scoring over 100! One student, little Aisha Khan from Guwahati, even managed a mind-boggling 150% on her Maths exam. We are not even sure how that's mathematically possible."

unnormalised: The problem seems to stem from a recent update to their AI-powered assessment system, ironically intended to be more accurate and personalized. Speculation is rife, ranging from mischievous coding elves to a sentient algorithm gone rogue, fuelled by too much chai and Bollywood.

unnormalised: "Our preliminary investigations point to a rather...enthusiastic algorithm," explained CTO Ms. Priya Sharma, trying to suppress a giggle. "It seems to be adding bonus marks for sheer effort, good handwriting (even on digital screens!), and, in some cases, simply because the student has a nice name. We found the system awarded little Rohan 5 extra marks just for having the same name as our Head of Marketing! "
